SEARCH
Module com.therealworld.fitschedule
Package com.therealworld.fitschedule.model

Class SqliteDAO

java.lang.Object
com.therealworld.fitschedule.model.SqliteDAO
public class SqliteDAO extends Object
Data Access Object (DAO) class responsible for interacting with the SQLite database for the FitSchedule application. Provides methods to perform CRUD operations on users, schedules, goals, badges, and other data entities.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    SqliteDAO()
    Default constructor that initializes the DAO with a shared database connection.

  • Constructor Details

    • SqliteDAO

      public SqliteDAO()
      Default constructor that initializes the DAO with a shared database connection. Creates necessary tables if they do not exist.

  • Method Details

    • createWeeklyScheduleTable

      public void createWeeklyScheduleTable(int userId)
      Creates the weekly schedule table for a specified user. This table is used to store the weekly events for a user.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user for whom the weekly schedule table should be created.

    • getUserId

      public int getUserId(String username)
      Retrieves the user ID for a given username.
      Parameters:
      username - the username to search for.
      Returns:
      the user ID if found, otherwise -1.

    • populateTimeSlots

      public void populateTimeSlots(int userId)
      Populates the weekly schedule table with predefined time slots for a specific user.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user for whom the time slots should be populated.

    • insertWeeklyEvent

      public void insertWeeklyEvent(int userId, String timeSlot, String dayOfWeek, String eventDescription)
      Inserts a weekly event for a specified user.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user to insert the event for.
      timeSlot - the time slot of the event.
      dayOfWeek - the day of the week for the event.
      eventDescription - a description of the event.

    • getWeeklySchedule

      public List<String[]> getWeeklySchedule(int userId)
      Retrieves the full weekly schedule for a specific user.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user to retrieve the schedule for.
      Returns:
      a list of String arrays where each array represents a row in the schedule table with time slots and events for each day of the week.

    • getAllUsers

      public List<User> getAllUsers()
      Retrieves all users from the database.
      Returns:
      a list of User objects containing details of each user.

    • getAllUserIds

      public List<Integer> getAllUserIds()
      Retrieves all user IDs from the database.
      Returns:
      a list of integers representing user IDs.

    • addUser

      public void addUser(String username, String password, String email, String phoneNumber)
      Adds a new user to the database.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the new user.
      password - the plaintext password of the new user.
      email - the email address of the new user.
      phoneNumber - the phone number of the new user.

    • insertSchedule

      public void insertSchedule(int userId, String dayOfWeek, String eventName, String eventDescription, String eventStartTime, String eventEndTime)
      Inserts a schedule into the `currentSchedule` table for a specific user.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user for whom the schedule should be added.
      dayOfWeek - the day of the week (e.g., "Monday") for the schedule.
      eventName - the name of the event.
      eventDescription - a brief description of the event.
      eventStartTime - the start time of the event.
      eventEndTime - the end time of the event.

    • getScheduleForUser

      public List<Schedule> getScheduleForUser(int userId)
      Retrieves the schedules for a specific user and day of the week.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user to retrieve schedules for.
      Returns:
      a list of `Schedule` objects representing the user's schedule for the current day.

    • getCommitmentsForDay

      public List<Schedule> getCommitmentsForDay(int userId, String dayOfWeek)
      Retrieves the commitments for a specific user and day of the week.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user to retrieve commitments for.
      dayOfWeek - the day of the week to retrieve commitments for (e.g., "Monday").
      Returns:
      a list of `Schedule` objects representing the user's commitments for the specified day.

    • deleteSchedule

      public void deleteSchedule(int scheduleId)
      Deletes a schedule entry from the `currentSchedule` table based on its ID.
      Parameters:
      scheduleId - the ID of the schedule entry to be deleted.

    • addGoal

      public void addGoal(int userId, String goalType, int goalDuration, String goalPeriod, String goalDescription, int goalCompleted)
      Adds a goal for a specific user in the `goals` table.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user to whom the goal belongs.
      goalType - the type of goal (e.g., "Fitness", "Academic").
      goalDuration - the duration of the goal (e.g., number of weeks).
      goalPeriod - the period of the goal (e.g., "Weekly").
      goalDescription - a brief description of the goal.
      goalCompleted - the completion status of the goal (0 for incomplete, 1 for complete).

    • deleteGoalFromDatabase

      public void deleteGoalFromDatabase(int goalId)
      Deletes a goal entry from the `goals` table based on its ID.
      Parameters:
      goalId - the ID of the goal entry to be deleted.

    • updateSchedule

      public void updateSchedule(Schedule schedule)
      Updates a schedule entry in the `currentSchedule` table.
      Parameters:
      schedule - the `Schedule` object containing updated values for the schedule.

    • updateGoal

      public void updateGoal(int goalId, String goalType, int goalDuration, String goalPeriod, String goalDescription)
      Updates a goal entry in the `goals` table based on its ID.
      Parameters:
      goalId - the ID of the goal entry to be updated.
      goalType - the type of the goal (e.g., "Fitness", "Academic").
      goalDuration - the duration of the goal (e.g., number of weeks).
      goalPeriod - the period of the goal (e.g., "Weekly").
      goalDescription - a brief description of the goal.

    • clearScheduleForUser

      public void clearScheduleForUser(int userId)
      Clears all schedule entries for a specific user from the `currentSchedule` table.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user whose schedule should be cleared.

    • validatePassword

      public boolean validatePassword(String username, String password)
      Validates the provided password against the stored hashed password in the `users` table.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user.
      password - the plaintext password provided by the user.
      Returns:
      `true` if the password matches the stored hash; `false` otherwise.

    • authenticateUser

      public boolean authenticateUser(String username, String password)
      Authenticates a user based on the provided username and password.
      Parameters:
      username - the username provided by the user.
      password - the plaintext password provided by the user.
      Returns:
      `true` if the user is authenticated successfully; otherwise, `false`.

    • getAllGoals

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Goal> getAllGoals()
      Retrieves all goals stored in the `goals` table.
      Returns:
      an `ObservableList` of `Goal` objects representing all goals in the database.

    • countGoals

      public int countGoals()
      Counts the total number of goals stored in the `goals` table.
      Returns:
      the total count of goals.

    • updateGoalAsCompleted

      public void updateGoalAsCompleted(int goalId)
      Marks a goal as completed by updating the `goal_completed` field to 1.
      Parameters:
      goalId - the ID of the goal to mark as completed.

    • getCompletedGoalsCount

      public int getCompletedGoalsCount()
      Retrieves the count of goals marked as completed in the `goals` table.
      Returns:
      the number of completed goals.

    • awardBadge

      public void awardBadge(int userId, String badgeName)
      Awards a badge to a user by inserting a new entry into the `badges` table.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user who earned the badge.
      badgeName - the name of the badge.

    • getUserBadges

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<String> getUserBadges(int userId)
      Retrieves all badges earned by a user from the `badges` table.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user to retrieve badges for.
      Returns:
      an `ObservableList` of badges (as strings) earned by the user.

    • initializeTotalGoalsCompleted

      public void initializeTotalGoalsCompleted(int userId)
      Initializes the `total_goals_completed` table for a user with a default value of 0.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user for whom to initialize the total goals completed.

    • getTotalGoalsCompleted

      public int getTotalGoalsCompleted(int userId)
      Retrieves the total number of goals completed by a user from the `total_goals_completed` table.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user.
      Returns:
      the total number of goals completed by the user.

    • incrementTotalGoalsCompleted

      public void incrementTotalGoalsCompleted(int userId)
      Increments the total number of goals completed by a user in the `total_goals_completed` table.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user whose total goals completed should be incremented.
